text: Hey everyone! I am Scott with UpContent (_App Partner for bringing curated articles to your HubSpot CMS, email, and social media efforts_). Looking forward to being a part of these conversations and being a part of the community!

Hi guys, yesterday in the CMS Roundtable, one of the panelists mentionned that there was a new CMS Hub Certif/Training live. But i can’t find it. Could someone send me a link? I did the CMS developer training already but not sure if there’s one specific to the new CMS hub... thx!
Hey Kim! There are some new lessons here: <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/academy/lessons/673>
cc <@U7SL518D6> <@U2H3TT8F2>
ah ok so it’s not a new certif?
thx for the quick reaction :smiley:
Just a few new lessons, but this will eventually grow into a new certification! <@U3PKJ8EQL>

Hey everyone ! I am going crazy. I am using the CSS stylesheet of HubSpot for a template. I applied css to my form to not exceed my section but nothing do. I applied `max-height: inherit;` and `height: XXXpx;` but nothing happened. Does it happened to someone before ?

I think that lesson is best described as an addendum to the CMS for Developers certification. Later this year, we'll revamp the entire CMS for Developers certification, but we wanted to give the community some time with the new tools and workflows before we bake them in to the certification.
do you have an example?
it’s likely you’re not clearing floats
can usually see this by adding overflow:hidden on the container

ok, makes sense :slightly_smiling_face: i wanted to have a more particular look at the new features, as it’s not clear to me what’s new. Content Staging, Drag and Drop were already there, for example. So from my POV, and as someone said yesterday,  looks like most new  features are aimed hardcore dev (serverless stuff, CMS CLI, ...)

Hi Kim, looks like you’re familiar with a lot of the pieces. As you said we had the new <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/templates/drag-and-drop-areas|dnd_areas> in developer preview ahead of CMS Hub Launch.

Some other highlights:
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/themes|Themes> in general are new, we released them into developer preview recently but they are officially live for everyone with CMS Hub


We’ve made big changes to how <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/global-content|global content> works for the marketer, and introduced global partials.


In our documentation too we’ve added a <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/key-concepts|high level overview> of how the whole system fits together, and it’s a really good idea even if you’ve been building on the CMS for a long time, to read through it.
Ty <@UQERM7BLY> for the answers
I sen you a pic and I try overflow:hidden
Here is what I was talking about
It works but I can’t resize my form. That’s the main problem...
amazing, thanks. That’s gonna help me a lot!
Happy to help. Let us know if you hit any stumbling blocks or find anything unclear.
Hello! I am new to this slack. I am attempting to change icon colors on a landing page and, I'm embarrassed to admit, am a little stuck. Does anyone have a helpful guide or resource?
Hey Allie, do you happen to have a link to the LP that you could post? This will help others identify ways in which you can accomplish this.
in the list of blogs you can migrate them fom one to another but you have to do it one at a time

Currently, what I'm trying is via Integromat to listen to Mailgun's trigger of an email being opened, then update the timeline for that user in HubSpot.

The trigger is simple enough, I'm having some issues figuring out how to properly update the timeline in HS
I'm being asked for these
